result.execSummary:
The defendant Otis James Thayer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Otis James Thayer in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Otis James Thayer in custody.  Bruce Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 16 CM 343 and 16 CT 50.  State recites plea agreement - DE to plead to 16 CT 50 OWI - $1429.00 - 10 days county jail credit 10 days - 12 mo dl revocation - AODA with VIP - 16 CM 159 - 30 days county jail consecutive to 16 CT 50 30 days time served - costs - 16 CM 343 count 1 - 75 days county jail consecutive 16 CM 159 75 days time served - costs.  DE entered plea of NC to 16 CT 50 count 1 - 16 CM 343  and 16 CM 59 count 1.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant Guilty 16 CT 50 - 16 CM 343 and 16 CM 59 (counts 1) - 16 CT 50 count 2 is dismissed.


Court:  16 CT 50: Fine $1429.00 - 10 days county jail with huber and credit for 10 days time served - 12 month DL revocation -  IID 12 months  effective 45 days from today - AODA and VIP - count 2 is dismissed

16 CM 159:  30 days county jail consecutive to 16 CT 50 with credit for 30 days time served - costs

16 CM 343: 75 days county jail consecutive to 16 CM 159 and credit for 75 days time served - costs - count 2 is dismissed and read-in
Motion hearing on December 19, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Otis James Thayer in court with attorney Paul Max Moldenhauer.  Defendant Otis James Thayer in custody appearing by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 3, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Combined Bond 16CM159 and 16CT50  
No consumption of alcoholic beverages.    
Standard STOP Program Conditions:
Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons.
Defendant shall not consume alcoholic beverages or illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.
Defendant is ordered to report to Health and Human Services at 10610 Main Street, Hayward, WI within 24 hours (excluding weekends and holidays) upon release from custody to schedule an intake with a STOP case manager (715-638-3317)for the purpose of  learning about the Court's intoxicated driver intervention program.  Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.

Defendant Otis James Thayer in court, in custody appears by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Warrant quashed.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.   Court enters NG Plea. Defendant shall not drive without a valid drivers license.

Failure to appear may result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, a bond modification hearing, possible bail jumping charges and / or forfeiture of any bond deposit.
